title: A Red Panda for Taipei Zoo

content.en: Taipei Zoo has a new animal from Japan! He's small. He's a fire-colored ball of fur. He's very cute and fluffy!
content.tw: 台北市動物園迎接日本來的新動物。牠很可愛還有蓬鬆的火紅色的毛。

content.en: His name is Mirai. He's a red panda! Mirai is four years old. A four-year-old human is a child, but Mirai is not a child. Red pandas live about ten to twelve years. Mirai is a young adult. He's here to be a dad!
content.tw: 牠的名字叫未來，是一隻4歲的小熊貓。小熊貓的壽命大約10到12歲。牠還很年輕，來台灣當小熊貓爸爸。

content.en: Mirai is full of energy. He's excited to meet you! Fan meetings with Mirai start in April. Bring your camera... but no flash, please! Maybe you can see Mirai do something cute! Or maybe you can see him climbing or having a snack.
content.tw: 從四月開始未來就會公開亮相，你可能會看到牠爬樹或吃點心。別忘囉! 拍照不要有閃光燈喔!

content.en: Every year, Mirai has fewer red panda friends in the world. There are less than ten thousand! Their tree homes are cut down. The places they live are getting hotter. And hotter weather is bad for them.
content.tw: 全世界的小熊貓每年越來越少，現在已經不到1萬隻了。牠們棲息的樹被砍掉，家園也越來越熱。

content.en: You can help by doing good things for the Earth. And when you visit Mirai, be nice to him!
content.tw: 你可以做環保幫助地球。記得去看未來的時候，要對牠好一點喔!

content.en: Mirai, Taiwan's new red panda, is waiting for you at the Taipei Zoo!
content.tw: 未來，台灣的新小熊貓，正在台北動物園等著你！

vocabulary.preface: 台北動物園的小熊貓，四月就可以去拜訪了。

content.text:
small 小的
Look at that poor thing! 你看那個可憐的小東西!
Oh my, it's so small. 天哪，牠好小。
Of course it's small. It's a baby bird. 當然小，牠是一隻鳥寶寶。

adult 成鳥
I wonder where the adults are. 不知道成鳥在哪裡。
You mean its parents? 你是說牠的爸媽?
I think they're out looking for food.我想出去找食物了。

bring 帶來
I do hope they bring back enough food. 我希望牠們帶足夠的食物回來。
That shouldn't be too hard. 那應該不會太難。

something 一些東西
Birds can always find something to eat. 鳥兒總會找到東西吃。
Let's come back and visit that baby bird again. 我們再回來看那隻小鳥吧。
Yeah, maybe we can see it grow up and fly. 好啊，也許能看到牠長大飛翔。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天單字很簡短又好用。
small小的
adult成鳥
bring帶來
something一些東西

How old is Mirai?
Which zoo is Mirai at?

content.en: In a city in Iceland, many people love cycling. But something bad was happening. Some people were stealing bikes! This worried bicycle owners. Some people stopped using their bikes.
content.tw: 冰島有個城市，居民都愛騎單車，但是單車容易失竊，一些人就不再騎單車了。

content.en: One man loves biking. He wanted more people to love it too. So he was very angry. He looked for the stolen bicycles. They were hard to find. But he didn't give up.
content.tw: 有個人很喜歡騎車，也希望更多人會喜歡。單車被偷走令他很生氣，他會到處找失竊的單車。

content.en: Sometimes he found stolen bikes where a group of people lived. He talked to them. He didn't like them because they stole things. But now they're his friends. They stopped stealing. Some help him find bikes now!
content.tw: 他找到失竊的車之後，也會跟小偷聊聊，請他們不要再偷車了。他們現在成為朋友，還會幫忙一起找失竊的單車。

content.en: The man returns bicycles to their owners. Now, after four years, he's famous. People call him the "bike whisperer." He's very good at finding bicycles!
content.tw: 這個人會把單車歸還給失主。他很會找失竊的單車，大家都稱他為「單車救星」。

content.en: He uses social media to help people.
content.tw: 他會用社群媒體來幫助人家。

content.en: Are you in Iceland? Did someone steal your bicycle? Ask the bike whisperer for help. Sometimes he finds bikes in two days!
content.tw: 你在冰島嗎?有人偷了你的單車嗎? 趕快找單車救星幫忙，有時候只要兩天就可以找到。

content.en: This man wants more people to love bicycling. He finds stolen bikes and he stops people from stealing them. He makes having a bicycle safer. He's the bike whisperer!
content.tw: 這個人希望更多人喜歡騎腳踏車。他找到失竊的腳踏車，並阻止人們偷竊它們。他讓擁有腳踏車變得更安全。他就是單車救星！

vocabulary.preface: 冰島這位單車救星，喜歡幫人尋找腳踏車。

content.text:
1. bike 腳踏車
My friend just told me he stole a bike yesterday.
我朋友剛剛告訴我他偷了一輛腳踏車。
What did you say? 你怎麼說呢?
I asked him why he did it.我問他為什麼要那樣。

2. steal 偷竊
He said it's because he loves biking. 他說因為他喜歡騎車。
So he decided to steal it? 所以就決定用偷的?
Yeah, I know it's a bad reason. 對，我知道這是個糟糕的理由。

3. angry 生氣的
Did you get angry? 你有生氣嗎?
No, why would I get angry? 沒有，我怎麼會生氣?
He didn't steal my bike. 他又不是偷我的車。

4. return 歸還
I did tell him to return it to the owner.我有告訴他把車子還給主人。
But he didn't know who the owner was. 但是他不知道主人是誰。
He said he'll put the bike back where he found it.
他說會把車子放回原先的地方。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天你學到哪些單字?
bike腳踏車
steal偷竊
angry生氣的
return歸還

quiz.question: 1. Where does the man live?
2. What do people call the man?
3. What is the man good at?

content.en: There's exciting news at the zoo! Guess what happened after Christmas! The holiday fun didn't end! In Germany, the Berlin Zoo had a special treat for their animals. The treat was... Christmas trees!
content.tw: 聖誕節過後，德國柏林動物園有特別的禮物要給園區的動物，那就是聖誕樹!

content.en: The elephants stepped on the trees. Then they pulled off the tree branches with their long trunks. They enjoyed munching on the branches. They ate their trees quickly.
content.tw: 大象會踏在樹幹上，用牠們長長的象鼻把樹枝扯下來，吃得津津有味。

content.en: The bison used the trees for fluffy pillows. Then they ate the trees. Reindeer, Santa Claus' special pets, used the trees for massages and body scrubs.
content.tw: 野牛會把樹當作枕頭，然後把它吃掉。馴鹿則是用樹幹來抓癢跟按摩。

content.en: The animals were very happy with their Christmas tree snacks and toys! But here's the surprise. Not all trees are good for the animals. The zookeepers only used fresh trees. They got them from Christmas tree sellers. These trees weren't sold. They were leftovers!
content.tw: 但不是所有的樹都適合動物，只能是新的樹。保育員從聖誕樹商店取得剩下的聖誕樹，送給動物。

content.en: The zookeepers never use trees from people's homes. These trees might not be clean for the animals to eat.
content.tw: 保育員從來不拿家裡用過的聖誕樹當作動物的食物，因為可能不衛生。

content.en: Every year, after Christmas Day, the zoo gives these special trees to their animals. This turns leftover Christmas trees into tasty treats and toys for cute zoo animals.
content.tw: 每年，聖誕節過後，動物園都會把這些特別的樹送給牠們的動物。這將剩餘的聖誕樹轉變為可愛動物園動物的美味點心和玩具。

vocabulary.preface: 柏林動物園把沒有用過的聖誕樹，當成送給動物的禮物。

content.text:
1. zookeeper 保育員
I took my son to the zoo on the weekend. 我周末帶我兒子去動物園。
Did you have lots of fun? 玩得開心嗎?
Oh yes, the zookeeper let him pet a pony。

2. enjoy 喜歡
He couldn't stop talking about it. 他一直講這件事，停不下來。
I guess he enjoyed it a lot! 我猜他很喜歡。

3. quickly 快速地
Yeah, so I quickly bought a stuffed toy horse for him.
所以我趕快去買了一個玩具馬給他。
And he loved that too! 他也很喜歡那個玩具。

4. cute 可愛的
My favorite animal in the zoo is the elephant. 我最喜歡的動物園動物是大象。
It's big, but very cute.

vocabulary.postscript:
What's your favorite animal in the zoo? 來一起讀單字。
zookeeper保育員
enjoy喜歡
quickly快速地
cute可愛的

quiz.question: 1. What did the reindeer do with the Christmas trees?
2. Where did the zoo get Christmas trees?
3. What do leftover Christmas trees turn into at this zoo?

title: A Fight About Pineapple Pizza in Italy

content.en: Something's in the oven. Let's guess what it is. It's round. The bottom is bread. On top, there's cheese, olive oil, basil...
content.tw: 烤箱裡是什麼? 我們來猜猜看，圓的，下面是麵包，有起司、橄欖油跟羅勒。

content.en: It's a pizza! What!? There are a lot of pineapple slices on the pizza too!? But there's no tomato sauce or ham! This isn't a Hawaiian pizza. It's a new kind of pineapple pizza!
content.tw: 居然還有很多的鳳梨，但是沒有番茄醬跟火腿。這不是夏威夷披薩，這是新的口味。

content.en: Pizza has a long history in Naples, the pizza city of Italy. There are even food laws to keep the traditional ways of making pizzas in Italy. This pineapple pizza isn't a traditional pizza. It's new!
content.tw: 義大利拿坡里有長遠的披薩歷史，甚至對披薩的傳統做法有法律規定。但是這個鳳梨披薩是新的披薩。

content.en: People love this new pineapple pizza... or they hate it. Some people like to try new pizzas. They hold a slice of the pizza and say "Yum!" Other people want to eat only traditional pizzas. They shake their heads and say "Nooo!" Uh oh! There's a food fight! It's on the TV news in Italy.
content.tw: 這種新的鳳梨披薩有人喜歡、有人討厭。有人願意嘗試，也有人只想吃傳統披薩。這掀起一場美食大戰，甚至上了義大利電視新聞。

content.en: Eating a pizza is all about sharing the many slices. Let's not fight. An order for the new pineapple pizza is coming right up! Do you want to try a bite?
content.tw: 吃披薩就是為了分享許多片。我們別吵架了。新鳳梨披薩的訂單馬上就來了！你想嘗一口嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 披薩口味越來越多元，每個人都有自己喜歡的披薩。

content.text:
1. make 做
I'm hungry. How about we make a pizza together? 我餓了。我們一起做個披薩如何?
Great idea; I love pizza! 好主意，我愛披薩。

2. tomato 番茄
I like olives, seafood and basil. 我喜歡橄欖，海鮮和羅勒。
And I like tomato sauce and lots of cheese. 我喜歡番茄醬，還有很多起司。
Okay, let's put those on our pizza.好，通通放在披薩上。

3. share 分享
Let's make a big one to share it with others. 我們做個大的，好跟別人分享。

4. oven 烤箱
Yeah, pizza is all about sharing. 對，披薩就是要分享。
Oh, no! I forgot my oven is broken. 糟了，我忘了我的烤箱壞了!
Where's the phone number of that pizza place nearby?
附近那家披薩店的電話是多少?

vocabulary.postscript:
來一起讀單字。
make做
tomato番茄
share分享
oven烤箱

2. What is on the TV news in this story?

title: A Day for the World's Readers

content.en: Scientists found a new kind of giant worm. They were thirty centimeters long! They swam in the ocean more than five hundred million years ago. Many ocean animals were small then. These giant worms ate lots and lots of them!
content.tw: 科學家找到一種新的巨大蠕蟲。牠們長30公分，生活在5億多年前的大海，當時的海生動物都很小，這些巨大蠕蟲掠食其他動物。

content.en: But today isn't World Worm Day. It's World Book Day! It's a day for bookworms! What are bookworms? Are they worms that eat books? No! Bookworms are people who love reading. Bookworms read lots and lots of books!
content.tw: 但是今天不是世界蠕蟲日，是世界閱讀日! 是書蟲的日子，不是啃書的蛀書蟲，而是指愛看書的人，他們讀很多很多書。

content.en: This funny name wasn't nice. People said, "Oh, she's a bookworm." But now, bookworms are cool! Reading helps us know about things. When scientists find something new, they write about it.
content.tw: 閱讀幫助我們學習新知。當科學家有新發現的時候，他們就會紀錄下來。

content.en: Now we know about those giant worms. Why? It's because a bookworm scientist wrote about them.
content.tw: 現在我們能知道這些巨大蠕蟲，就是因為有一位書蟲科學家把牠寫了下來。

content.en: World Book Day is a special day for bookworms! You can be a bookworm too!
content.tw: 世界閱讀日對書蟲來說是特別的日子! 你也可以成為書蟲!

content.en: Today is World Worm Day!! Uh… Wait… That's not right. It's World Book Day! Read more books!
content.tw: 今天是世界蠕蟲日！！呃…等等…那不對。這是世界閱讀日！多讀點書！

vocabulary.preface: 世界閱讀日鼓勵大家多看書。

content.text:
1. read 閱讀
Are you reading again? 你又在看書了?
Did you go to the Book Fair? 你有去書展嗎?
Of course I did. How could I miss it? 當然有啦，我怎麼可能錯過?

2. interesting 有趣的
So you found something interesting? 所以你找到一些有趣的東西?
Oh yes, I found lots of fun books. 有，我找到很多好玩的書。
Like this one.比如說這一本。

3. learn 學習
Let me see. 我看看。
"How to Learn More without Trying?" 《如何不費力卻學更多》?
Do you really believe this? 你真的相信這個喔?
Don't know. I haven't finished reading it yet. 不知道。我還沒看完。

4. kind 種類
But it's my kind of book. 不過這種書很適合我。
Learning without trying. 不用努力就學會。

vocabulary.postscript:
一起來讀單字。
read閱讀
interesting有趣的
learn學習
kind種類

quiz.question: 1. What are people who love reading called?
2. What kind of new worm did scientists find?
options: c. A worm that eats books

quiz.question: 3. What is today?

content.en: Voice: Ewww, gross! *gasp* What did I do?! I'M SORRY, COCKROACH!!!
content.tw: 聲音：噁，好噁心！ *喘氣* 我做了什麼？！對不起，蟑螂！！！

content.en: Narrator: Most people aren't sad about killing these big brown bugs!
content.tw: 旁白：大多數人殺死這些大棕色蟲子時並不會感到難過！

content.en: Cockroaches are pests. Mosquitoes, flies, and other bugs are pests too. Pests carry lots of germs and diseases. Pests can make you very sick.
content.tw: 蟑螂、蚊子跟蒼蠅等等都是害蟲。牠們身上有很多細菌跟病毒讓人生病。

content.en: Pesticides are special sprays, gels, and smells that kill pests. Big companies have their own bugs for testing. They want to make sure their pesticides kill bugs.
content.tw: 殺蟲劑是特殊的噴霧、凝膠跟氣味。大公司會養害蟲測試殺蟲的功效。

content.en: In Japan, one pesticide company has around one million cockroaches and more than one hundred million ticks!
content.tw: 日本有一間殺蟲劑公司需要大約100萬隻蟑螂跟超過一億隻的壁蝨。

content.en: This company kills millions of bugs. It kills them to keep people safe from disease. But killing bugs makes the company's workers very sad.
content.tw: 這間公司殺了數百萬隻蟲，雖然是為了預防疾病，但是殺蟲還是讓員工很難過。

content.en: Every year, this company has a ceremony at a temple. The ceremony is to thank the dead bugs. A priest prays in front of many pictures of dead bugs. It's very sad and very serious …
content.tw: 每一年公司都會在寺廟設祭壇，感謝這些死掉的蟲子，場面嚴肅而哀傷。

content.en: Goodbye, dead pests! The next time you see a bug, why not … Yuck! Whoops …
content.tw: 再見了，死去的害蟲！下次你看到蟲子的時候，為什麼不…噁！哎呀…

vocabulary.preface: 日本這家殺蟲劑公司，每年紀念犧牲的昆蟲。

content.text:
1. mosquito 蚊子
There! Got you! 打到你了!
Another mosquito? 又一隻蚊子?
Why do we have so many mosquitoes this year? 今年我們怎麼這麼多蚊子?

2. fly 蒼蠅
Look at your broken window. 看看你破掉的窗戶。
That's why.那就是原因。
You're right. Just yesterday 3 flies came in. 你說對了，昨天三隻蒼蠅跑進來。

3. make sure 確保
They didn't stop on my bread, did they? 他們沒有停在我的麵包上吧?
No, I made sure they were dead. 沒有，我確保牠們死了。
That's really something! 這個就厲害了!

4. pesticide 殺蟲劑
How did you do it? 你是怎麼辦到的?
Easy. I used pesticide. 很簡單，我用了殺蟲劑。
Uh…That's actually not a good idea. 那其實不是個好主意。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天你學到那些單字?
mosquito蚊子
fly蒼蠅
make sure確保
pesticide殺蟲劑

quiz.question: 1. What do pests carry?
2. Which of these are not pests?
3. How many ticks does the pesticide company have?
options: a. More than one hundred million

content.en: A special fish called a seahorse lives in the ocean. Its head looks like a horse's head. But it's much smaller than a horse!
content.tw: 住在海裡的海馬，頭都看起來像馬，但比馬小非常多。

content.en: Seahorses live under rocks and inside corals. But sometimes boats bump into their homes. Sometimes big storms blow their homes away! Then hungry ocean animals can find them.
content.tw: 海馬住在石頭底下或珊瑚礁中。但有時候船隻會撞到牠們的家，暴風雨也會把家吹走，其他飢餓的海洋動物就很容易找到牠們。

content.en: An aquarium is a zoo for fish. In Australia, an aquarium and a group of scientists both take care of baby seahorses. Later, they take them to the ocean. The scientists make seahorse hotels. These hotels are old nets and cages. Corals and ocean plants grow on them.
content.tw: 澳洲有一間水族館跟一群科學家照顧海馬寶寶，再把牠們放回大海。科學家利用舊漁網跟籠子讓珊瑚跟海生植物生長，打造了海馬旅館。

content.en: These hotels are safe from boats and storms. They keep those hungry ocean animals out! And they help more seahorses live and have babies in the ocean. People swimming near these hotels can see these fish now!
content.tw: 這些旅館不會被船或暴風雨破壞，也防止海馬被其他的動物吃掉，讓海馬可以生存繁衍後代。

content.en: Aquariums, scientists, and seahorse hotels are helping these special fish have a new start in Australia! Go, fish!
content.tw: 水族館、科學家和海馬旅館正在幫助這些特別的魚類在澳洲重新開始！加油，魚兒們！

vocabulary.preface: 科學家做了海底旅館給海馬住。

content.text: 1. aquarium 水族館 I love zoos, but I love aquariums more. 我喜歡動物園，不過更喜歡水族館。Because they are more colorful? 因為顏色比較繽紛? Because I don't need to walk a lot in an aquarium. 因為水族館裡不需要走很多路。
2. animal 動物 That's true. And ocean animals are so cute! 那是真的。而且海洋動物好可愛! Yeah, all those tropical fish, oysters, shrimp…對啊，那些熱帶魚，牡蠣，蝦子...
3. take 帶領 I'm sure there are no oysters in an aquarium. 我確定水族館裡沒有牡蠣。There are. Let me take you to Keelung tomorrow. 有的，我明天帶你去基隆看。
4. hungry 飢餓的 The truth is I'm hungry for seafood. 其實我是很想吃海鮮。Me too! 我也是!

vocabulary.postscript: 請跟我一起讀單字。aquarium水族館animal動物take帶領hungry飢餓的

quiz.question: 1. Where do seahorses live?
2. What are seahorse hotels made from?
3. What is true about seahorses?

content.en: There's a sport for everyone! If you're fast, you can run. If you're strong, you can lift weights. If you're creative and love nature, you can hug a tree!
content.tw: 如果你速度夠快，可以去賽跑。力氣夠大，可以去舉重。現在有個適合大家的運動，如果你很有創意又熱愛大自然，你可以去抱樹。

content.en: Finland is a country in northern Europe. It's full of trees. More than 70% of Finland is forest! Every year, people from everywhere go to a forest there. They take part in … the TreeHugging World Championships!
content.tw: 芬蘭是一個北歐國家，而且超過七成的領土是森林。每年世界各地的人都會到芬蘭的森林參加擁抱大樹世界錦標賽。

content.en: These people do three tasks in this contest. First, they give hugs to as many trees as they can for one minute!
content.tw: 參賽者需要做三個項目。首先他們要比誰在一分鐘內抱最多的樹。

content.en: Second, they hug their favorite tree as hard as they can for one minute! The hug needs to show love for the tree.
content.tw: 第二個是他們要緊緊抱住他們喜歡的樹，表達對樹的喜愛。

content.en: Third, they give a tree a very special hug for one minute. The hug can be as creative as they like! They can stand on their hands and hug a tree upside down!
content.tw: 最後他們要用創意的方式擁抱大樹一分鐘，像是倒立擁抱大樹。

content.en: This contest was made to get people everywhere to love and care for trees.
content.tw: 這個比賽讓世界各地的人愛護樹木。

content.en: Today is Arbor Day, a special day about trees! If you love trees, today's a good day to hug one!
content.tw: 今天是植樹節，一個關於樹木的特別日子！如果你愛樹木，今天真是擁抱一棵樹的好日子！

vocabulary.preface: 你真得是一個熱愛樹木的人，才能參加這種比賽。

content.text:
1. forest 森林
Don't you just love seeing so many trees? 你喜歡看到這麼多樹吧!
Yeah, it's almost like a forest. 對啊，幾乎像個森林。
It IS a forest. 它是一座森林啊。

2. full of 充滿
Not quite yet, but it's getting there.還沒有到那個程度，不過快了。
What I like about this place is that it's full of flowers.
我喜歡這個地方有好多花。
Yeah, so many azaleas. 對，好多杜鵑花。

3. everywhere 到處
They have different flowers in different seasons. 不同季節有不同的花。
And you can see them everywhere in the park.公園裡到處都看得到。

4. run 跑步
You know this park well. 你對這座公園很熟。
I should. I run around the park every
morning.我應該熟，我每天早上都在這裡跑步。

vocabulary.postscript:
Are you a tree lover?
forest森林
full of充滿
everywhere到處
run跑步

quiz.question: 1. What do people hug in the contest?
2. Where is Finland?
3. When does this contest happen?

title: Very Big Goldfish in Lakes Worry Scientists

content.en: Goldfish are good pets. They're small. They can live in a small fishbowl. They're easy to take care of.
content.tw: 金魚是很好養的寵物，牠們小小的，可以養在小魚缸裡。

content.en: But goldfish aren't always small. They can get very big. Now fishermen are finding big goldfish in the Great Lakes in the USA and Canada.
content.tw: 但是金魚也可以變得很大隻，漁民位於在加拿大和美國的五大湖找到大金魚。

content.en: Scientists say pet goldfish don't belong in lakes. They belong in fishbowls. But some people don't want their goldfish anymore. They put their fish in lakes.
content.tw: 科學家說金魚不應該在湖裡，應該在魚缸裡。但是有一些人不想養了，就把魚野放到湖裡。

content.en: One scientist says goldfish eat "anything and everything." But not many animals eat goldfish. And these fish have many baby fish every year!
content.tw: 一位科學家還說金魚什麼都吃，但是沒有什麼動物會吃牠們，而且每一年又生很多金魚寶寶。

content.en: Now there are millions of very big goldfish in the Great Lakes. Scientists are very worried. The fish aren't good for lake water. They aren't good for the plants and animals there.
content.tw: 五大湖現在有數百萬隻超大金魚，牠們對湖泊的水質、動植物都有害，讓科學家很擔心。

content.en: Goldfish are sooooo cute! People see them and want them! These fish are forty centimeters long! *gasp* They're as big as American footballs! Can you imagine a football in a fishbowl? Small, cute goldfish eat everything in lakes and get very big. Let's help keep lakes free from gol…
content.tw: 金魚真是太可愛了！人們看到牠們就想要！這些魚有四十公分長！天啊！牠們跟美式足球一樣大！你能想像一個足球在魚缸裡嗎？小小的可愛金魚在湖裡什麼都吃，而且長得很大隻。讓我們一起幫助湖泊擺脫金魚的困擾吧…

vocabulary.preface: 超大金魚有可能破壞自然環境。

content.text:
1. small 小的
What a lovely fishbowl! 好可愛的魚缸! And you have five goldfish there! 你有五條金魚! Yeah, I used to have 8, but maybe my fishbowl is too small. 對，我以前有八條魚，但我的金魚缸可能太小了。

2. belong 屬於
Maybe they belong in a pond. 也可能牠們屬於池塘。 No, my fishbowl is a nice place. 不會，我的金魚缸是個好地方。

3. everything 所有東西
See how happy these five goldfish are! 你看這五條魚多快樂! What do they eat? 牠們吃什麼呢? They eat everything. 什麼都吃。

4. centimeter 公分
I sometimes feed them cooked rice. 我有時候餵牠們吃飯。 Will they grow bigger? 牠們會不會長更大? Yeah, to at least 10 centimeters. 會，至少長到十公分長。

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you like goldfish? 來讀一遍單字。
small小的
belong屬於
everything所有東西
centimeter公分

quiz.question: 1. How many centimeters long can goldfish get?
2. Where do scientists say pet goldfish belong?
3. Where are the goldfish in this story?

title: The Mystery Cleaner in the Workshop

content.en: Kid: I wish … I wish someone would clean my room!
content.tw: 小孩：我希望…我希望有人能清理我的房間！

content.en: Narrator: Some kids dream of never needing to clean their room again. Can this dream come true?
content.tw: 有一些小孩夢想永遠不用清理房間，這夢想有可能實現嗎?

content.en: Well, a man in Wales is living this dream. He has a workshop. It's a place where he makes or fixes things. His workshop has many small things in it: nuts, bolts, nails, and more.
content.tw: 有一個住在威爾斯的人就活在這種夢想裡!他有一間工作室，裡面有很多小東西，像是螺帽、螺栓、釘子等等。

content.en: He puts the small things here, there, and everywhere. But every morning, his workshop is cleaned up! All of the small things are in a box.
content.tw: 這些東西散在各處。但是每天早上，有人會收拾他的工作室，所有的小東西都收進盒子裡。

content.en: The man thought "Who is doing this for me?" It was a big mystery.
content.tw: 這個男人心想：「誰在幫我做這件事？」這是一個大謎團。

content.en: He put a video camera in his workshop. Then he watched the video. The cleaner wasn't a person! It was a mouse! Can you imagine a mouse cleaning up for you? That's amazing!
content.tw: 他放了一台攝影機在工作室裡，發現是一隻老鼠在幫他收拾東西。太不可思議了!

content.en: Was the mouse strong? The man wanted to find out. He gave the mouse some challenges. He put out heavier things. And guess what? This mouse can lift!
content.tw: 他好奇這隻老鼠夠不夠強壯，故意放一些比較重的東西。結果老鼠還是可以把物品舉起來。

content.en: This man in Wales never worries about cleaning up now. It's all thanks to the mouse! Do you dream of having a mouse too?
content.tw: 這位住在威爾斯的人現在從不用擔心打掃問題。這一切都多虧了那隻老鼠！你也夢想擁有一隻老鼠嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 老鼠會收拾零碎東西，你聽過這種事嗎?

content.text:
1. never 從不
Cleaning up is never a problem for me. 打掃清潔對我從來不是問題。
Never ever? 從來不是嗎?
Right, because my younger sister does it for me. 對，因為我妹妹會幫我做。

2. imagine 想像
Such a nice sister! 這麼好的妹妹!
I can't imagine any of my sisters doing that. 我不能想像我的姐妹會那樣。

3. workshop 工作室
So you've got a problem. 所以你有個難題。
No, I don't. 我沒有。
Because I sleep in my workshop. 因為我睡在工作室。

4. worry 擔心
It only has a bed, a desk and a chair. 那裏只有一張床，桌子和椅子。
Very simple.非常簡單。
And you don't worry about dust? 你不擔心灰塵?
Not at all.一點也不。

vocabulary.postscript:
你今天學到哪些單字?
never從不
imagine想像
workshop工作室
worry擔心

quiz.question: 1. Who is cleaning up the workshop?
2. In the morning, what are all the things in?
3. What does the man use to find out who is cleaning up?

content.en: It's spring! The sun is shining. It makes flowers bloom. It makes the weather warmer.
content.tw: 春天來了！陽光普照。它讓花朵綻放。它讓天氣變暖和。

content.en: Electricity makes TVs and lights work. Fuel makes planes and cars move. What makes the sun shine?
content.tw: 電視跟電燈靠電力運作，飛機跟汽車則依賴燃油推動。那太陽靠著什麼發光呢?

content.en: The sun is made of many very small things called atoms. These atoms like to bounce around very fast. Sometimes, they hit each other hard and stick together! When this happens, the atoms become one bigger thing!
content.tw: 太陽由很小的原子組成。這些原子會互相碰撞融合，成為更大的東西。

content.en: Lots of energy comes out. It makes the sun shine! This is nuclear fusion!
content.tw: 這就是核融合，這個過程會釋放很多能量，讓太陽發光。

content.en: We need this kind of energy. It's good energy. It won't make the environment dirty. So scientists are trying to copy the sun. But it's hard!
content.tw: 我們需要這種能源，因為它不會汙染環境。

content.en: Scientists used many strong lights called lasers. They used lasers to shoot at atoms. This made the atoms bounce around very fast and hit each other - just like a mini sun!
content.tw: 科學家對著原子發出雷射光，讓原子產生反應互相碰撞，就像一顆迷你的太陽。

content.en: Some energy came out. The electricity from this energy can boil water in a kettle. Scientists are trying to make better mini suns. The world needs lots of energy!
content.tw: 釋放的能源還可以燒開水。科學家努力製造更好的迷你太陽，因為世界需要很多能源。

content.en: Scientists are working on nuclear fusion so we can have a better world!
content.tw: 科學家正致力於核融合技術，這樣我們就能擁有一個更美好的世界！

vocabulary.preface: 科學家努力模仿太陽的作用，希望產生更多能源。

content.text:
1. each other 彼此
Do you see that boy and girl? 你看到那個男孩跟女孩嗎?
Do you see how they look at each other? 你有看到他們怎麼看彼此嗎?

2. happen 發生
Yeah, what about it? 看到了，又怎樣呢?
Their eyes are shining. 他們的眼睛發亮。
So they're in love. 所以他們在談戀愛。
No, that's not what's happening. 不對，不是那樣。

3. energy 能源、能量
Then what do you think is happening? 那你覺得發生了什麼事?
There's this energy between them. 他們之間有一種能量。

4. light 光線
Right, the energy of love. 對，愛的能量。
No, it's the energy of light. 不對，是光的能量。
You're weird, you know that? 你是個怪人，你知道嗎?

vocabulary.postscript:
這些單字很好用。
each other彼此
happen發生
energy能源、能量
light光線

quiz.question: 1. What makes planes and cars move?
2. What are the scientists trying to copy?
3. What can the mini sun do now?

content.en: Gacha gacha! That's fun to say! The sound of the crank on a gachapon machine is called gacha gacha!
content.tw: 嘎洽嘎洽！唸起來真有趣！扭蛋機的搖桿轉動時，會發出「嘎洽嘎洽」的聲音！

content.en: Gachapon machines are full of small toys. You put money in, you twist the crank, and a plastic pod falls onto the tray. The toy is in the pod!
content.tw: 扭蛋機裡有很多小玩具，只要投幣，轉一下旋轉鈕。一顆塑膠扭蛋就會掉出來，裡面有個玩具。

content.en: Gachapon toys are part of a set. There are anime sets, manga sets, wacky cartoon sets, and more. Most people aren't happy with one toy. They want the whole set!
content.tw: 扭蛋玩具都是一整套。大部分的人都會想要一整組漫畫或是卡通玩具，而不是只有一個。

content.en: You never know which toy you'll get. And the toy you want almost never comes out! To get the whole set, you have to put money in again and again and again. It's easy to spend lots of money on gachapon toys!
content.tw: 你永遠不知道會拿到哪一個玩具，也總是拿不到想要的。要拿到一整組就要一直投幣，很容易一下子就花了很多錢。

content.en: The world's biggest gachapon store is in Tokyo, Japan. It has more than 3,000 machines and millions of toys!
content.tw: 全世界最大的扭蛋機商店在日本東京，它有超過3000個扭蛋機跟上百萬個玩具。

content.en: Gacha gacha … What a great word! It cranks and clanks, and winds and grinds! What else is named for the sound it makes? Hey! That was a "pon." Ohhhh! Gachapon!
content.tw: 嘎洽嘎洽…真是個很棒的詞！它發出搖動和撞擊的聲音，還有轉動和研磨的聲音！還有什麼東西是以它發出的聲音命名的呢？嘿！那是一個「碰」。喔喔喔！Gachapon！

vocabulary.preface: 很多人喜歡扭蛋機裡面的玩具，並且收集一整套。

content.text:
1. full of 充滿的
Hey, I've been watching this anime series. 我最近都在看動漫影集。
It's full of adventure! 它裡面有好多冒險!
Cool! Which one? 真酷，是哪一部?
It's called Detective Conan. 叫做《名偵探柯南》。

2. Again and again 一次又一次
I've watched it again and again. 我看了一遍又一遍。
Is it really that good? 真的有那麼好?
It's great! I really enjoy it.

3. have to 一定要
But I usually just read manga. 不過我通常只看漫畫。
No, you have to give this one a try. 不，你一定要試著看這一部。

4. know 知道
I don't know.我不知道。
I guess I'll watch it after I finish reading One Piece.
我想我會在讀完《海賊王》之後去看吧。

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you like manga or anime? 來讀單字。
full of充滿的
again and again一次又一次
have to一定要
know知道

quiz.question: 1. What are gachapon machines full of?
2. Where is the world's biggest gachapon store?
3. What is the sound of the crank on a gachapon machine called?

title: Telling Stories Again and Again and Again

content.en: Narrator: Everyone has a favorite story. Some people love The Three Little Pigs …
content.tw: 旁白：每個人都有一個最喜歡的故事。有些人喜歡《三隻小豬》……

content.en: Big Bad Wolf: Little pig … I'll blow your house down!!!
content.tw: 大野狼：小豬……我要把你的房子吹倒！！！

content.en: Little Pig: Oh no! Ahhhh!
content.tw: 小豬：喔不！啊啊啊！

content.en: Narrator: … Some people love the Chinese story about the Monkey King.
content.tw: 大家都有喜歡的故事。有一些人喜歡三隻小豬，也有人喜歡西遊記。

content.en: Other people love Cinderella …
content.tw: 其他人喜歡《灰姑娘》……

content.en: Prince Charming: Whose shoe is this?
content.tw: 白馬王子：這是誰的鞋子？

content.en: Narrator: … Snow White …
content.tw: 旁白：……《白雪公主》……

content.en: Evil Witch: Yessss! Eat the apple!
content.tw: 邪惡女巫：哼哼哼！吃蘋果吧！

content.en: Narrator: … or Humpty Dumpty.
content.tw: 旁白：……或是《蛋頭先生》。

content.en: Humpty Dumpty: I'm an egg, and I fell off a wall! Oh no!
content.tw: 也有人喜歡灰姑娘，白雪公主或是蛋頭先生。

content.en: Narrator: These wonderful stories are with us because people told them again and again and again. Many years later, people put these stories in books. Then more people told these stories!
content.tw: 這些故事還存在的原因是人們口耳相傳。之後又有人把故事寫下來，讓更多人說故事!

content.en: Some of our favorite stories are very, very old. Today's Cinderella story is more than 300 years old! It came from France. But people in China told a Cinderella story too - more than 1,000 years ago! And people in Greece told a Cinderella story - more than 2,000 years ago!
content.tw: 現今的灰姑娘版本源自於法國，有三百年的歷史。但是一千多年前，中國就有像灰姑娘的故事。兩千多年前的希臘也有。

content.en: People told Cinderella's story again and again and again and again. Maybe it went from Greece to China to France and then to us!
content.tw: 人們不斷地說灰姑娘的故事，說不定這是一路從希臘、中國、法國傳到現在。

content.en: Today is World Storytelling Day! Tell someone your favorite story!
content.tw: 今天是世界說故事日！告訴某人你最喜歡的故事吧！

vocabulary.preface: 大人小孩都喜歡聽故事，很多故事源遠流長。

content.text:
1. tell story 講故事
Tell me a story, Paz. 講故事給我聽。
Okay, what would you like to hear? 好，你想聽什麼?
A story about your childhood? 你童年時候的故事?

2. come from 來自
Okay. I have this uncle who loved to take us out to sea.
我有個叔叔，喜歡帶我們坐船出海。
Where does he come from? 他是哪裡人?
He's from DR, a fisherman. 多明尼加人，是個漁夫。

3. wonderful 奇妙的
And one time he took us out fishing for lobsters. 有一次他帶我們去抓龍蝦。
Wow!! 哇!
Yeah, it was a wonderful experience! 對啊，很奇妙的經驗。
We caught more than 10 lobsters.我們抓到10多隻龍蝦。

4. put 放置
Did you cook them right away? 有沒有馬上煮熟?
No, we put them in a bag, 沒有，我們把牠放在袋子裡，and cooked and ate them
on the beach. 在沙灘上煮了吃。

vocabulary.postscript:
來看今天的單字。
tell story講故事
come from來自
wonderful奇妙的
put放置

quiz.question: 1. Where is the Monkey King story from?
2. What country has a Cinderella story?
3. What day is today?

title: The Tail of a Whale Tells All

content.en: Whales are big, beautiful animals. Some of them are as long as three buses!
content.tw: 鯨魚是龐大又美麗的動物，有一些鯨魚跟三輛公車一樣長。

content.en: Many people want to see whales. Some of us go on boats to watch them. But nobody knows where and when we can see them. And many times, we see the tail or a very small part.
content.tw: 很多人會坐船賞鯨，但是沒有人知道在哪裡或是什麼時候能見到鯨魚。很多時候只能看到尾巴或一小部分。

content.en: We try to take pictures. But whales don't stop moving! It's hard to take pictures! But they let us feel a little closer to the whales we see. What's another way to feel closer?
content.tw: 我們都希望拍到鯨魚照片，讓我們覺得我們離鯨魚更近。還有什麼其他的方法呢?

content.en: Some scientists found a smart way. They use Artificial Intelligence, or AI, in an app. It knows the tails of 70,000 whales! Every tail is different.
content.tw: 科學家找到一個聰明的方法，他們用人工智慧AI在新發明的應用軟體上，這個軟體記錄了7萬頭鯨魚的尾巴，每個尾巴都不同。

content.en: We upload a picture of our whale's tail. The app finds whose tail it is.
content.tw: 上傳鯨魚尾巴的照片，系統就會幫你找到是哪一隻鯨魚。

content.en: The app shows the whale's name if it has one. We can see where people saw it. When it has no name, we can name it!
content.tw: 應用軟體還會告訴你鯨魚的名字，在哪裡看過牠。如果牠沒有名字，我們可以幫牠取名。

content.en: AI helps us learn more about the whales we see. It uses our pictures of their tails. Now we can feel closer to these big, beautiful animals!
content.tw: AI 幫助我們更了解我們看到的鯨魚。它利用我們拍攝的鯨魚尾巴照片。現在我們可以感覺更接近這些巨大美麗的動物了！

vocabulary.preface: 用AI來尋找特定的鯨魚，賞鯨不再是大海撈針。

content.text:
1. take pictures 拍照
This is so nice! To be out here on the sea! 出來在大海上真好!
It's very nice, but I'm here to take pictures of whales.

2. feel 感覺
They will come. You'll see. 牠們會來，你也會看到的。
I can feel them close by. 我感覺牠們就在附近。
You can FEEL they're close? 你可以感覺到牠們在附近?

3. when 什麼時候
Nobody knows when a whale will show up! 沒有人知道鯨魚什麼時候會出現。
Oh but I do.我就可以。

4. know 知道
There they are! 就在那裏。
More than one! 不只一頭!
I told you.我就跟你說啊。
How did you know? 你是怎麼知道的?
I have no idea. I just did. 我也不知道，我就是知道。

content.en: Sleep is important. People need comfortable beds to sleep well. But some people don't have beds. They don't sleep well.
content.tw: 睡眠很重要。人們需要舒服的床才能睡得好。

content.en: Two or three percent of kids in the USA don't have beds. Are you shocked?
content.tw: 美國有百分之二到百分之三的兒童沒有床，是不是讓人嚇一跳!

content.en: One man in the USA was very shocked. Sleep helps kids do well in school. He wanted to help these kids sleep well. First, he built a bed for one kid. Then he asked a good friend to help him. They built more beds for more kids.
content.tw: 有個美國人非常驚訝，他想要幫助兒童睡好，讓他們在學校有更好的表現。所以他跟朋友一起為兒童製作床。

content.en: The man started a group to make beds. Families can help build their own beds. Sometimes young kids help build the beds.
content.tw: 他也成立團隊，孩子們的家人可以來做自己的床。有時候也有兒童會來幫忙。

content.en: The group has made beds for more than one hundred forty thousand families. That's a lot of beds! But many more kids need beds. There's a lot of work to do!
content.tw: 這個團隊幫助14萬個家庭，但是仍然有很多兒童需要床。

content.en: Why does this man help kids have beds? He doesn't do it to make money. It's because he likes to help people. This makes him feel good.
content.tw: 為什麼這個人要幫助小孩有床呢?他並不是為了賺錢，而是因為他喜歡伸出援手，這樣讓他覺得很開心。

content.en: This man helps kids have beds. Now they can sleep well! Sweet dreams, everyone!
content.tw: 這個人幫助孩子們擁有床。現在他們可以睡個好覺了！祝大家有個美夢！

vocabulary.preface: 故事裡這個人，希望每個小孩都可以躺在自己的床上睡覺。

content.text:
1. feel 感覺
You look a bit pale. 你看起來有點蒼白。
Don't feel well? 不大舒服嗎?
No, didn't sleep well. 不是，沒睡好。

2. family 家人
Yesterday my sister and her family came to visit.
昨天我妹妹和她的家人來看我。 I love my nieces, but they wanted to sleep with
me! 我很愛我的外甥女，但是她們要跟我一起睡!

3. ask 請求
You could ask them to sleep on the sofa.你可以要她們睡沙發啊。
Well, I gave them my bed. 結果我給她們睡床。
I slept on the floor. 我睡地上。
That's tough! 這有點麻煩。

4. thousand 千
And then they asked me to tell them stories. 然後她們要我講故事。
From One Thousand and One Nights. 一千零一夜的故事!
That's a lot of stories! 那是很多故事呢!
Exactly. 就是啊。
